Dated this the 3" day of August, 2016 ORDER The petitioner herein is the sole accused in Crime No.1863/2016 of Adoor Police Station for offences punishable under Sections 452, 294(b), 323, 354 and 506(i) of IPC read with Sections 3(1)(s), 3(1),(w)(i), 3(2) (VA) of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities), Amendment Act, 2015. 2. The allegation of the defacto complainant is that, the petitioner herein had assaulted her. According to the learned counsel for the petitioner, actually there was a monetary dispute between the wife of the petitioner and the defacto complainant which promoted the defacto complainant to set up a false case. Even in the Fl statement, there is a reference about a monetary transaction. The learned counsel submits that, he is ready and willing to surrender before the court below. However, his apprehension is that, the bail application submitted by him is not likely to be taken up on the same day. Having regard to the limited prayer sought for by him, this Crl.M.C. is disposed of with a direction that in the event of the Bee 2016/KER/33890 Cri. M. C. No. 4901 of 2016 2 petitioner surrendering before the court below and files an application for bail, the same shall be considered by the court below on the same day, having regard to the spirit of the decisions reported in Shanu V. State of Kerala (2000 (3) KLT 452) and Ali V. State of Kerala (2000 (2) KLT 280) and also the contention of the learned counsel for the petitioner that the present case only an offshoot of a monetary dispute. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE. Pn
